commander.name: Ernest N. Harmon
commander.previous_service: Deputy Chief of Staff, 2nd Armored Division (1941-1942)

M4 Sherman.notes: 75mm gun. 55 landed at Safi (67th AR), remainder with 66th AR

M3 Lee.notes: 75mm gun in hull sponson, 37mm gun in turret

M5 Stuart.notes: 37mm gun. Beginning to replace M3 Stuarts

M2 Halftrack.role: Armored personnel carrier for armored infantry

M45 Quadmount .50 cal.notes: Four .50 cal M2 machine guns on halftrack mount

supply_logistics.supply_status: Good - garrison duties only. Division remained in Morocco for training after Operation Torch landings. Limited combat operations meant supply situation remained stable. Only elements deployed (66th and 67th Armored Regiment battalions), with remainder of division arriving later for training and reorganization. No significant supply strain during Q4 1942.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Moroccan coastal plains and Atlas Mountain foothills. Training areas around Casablanca region. Less harsh than Tunisian combat zone.

subordinate_units.notes: Three tank battalions. 1st Battalion deployed to Mehedia (Northern Attack Group) for Operation Torch
Three tank battalions. 2nd and 3rd Battalions deployed to Safi (Southern Attack Group). 55 M4 Shermans landed at Safi
18x M7 Priest 105mm SPG. Reduced from regiment to battalion status in Jan 1942 reorganization
18x M7 Priest 105mm SPG. Added in Jan 1942 reorganization
M8 Greyhound armored cars, M3 scout cars, light tanks
Flexible combined arms task force. Composition varied by mission

tactical_doctrine.role: Armored exploitation and breakthrough force. Heavy armored division with 18 tank companies (vs 12 in light divisions) providing superior tank strength for sustained mobile operations.
special_capabilities: Heavy division structure: Two armored regiments with 18 total tank companies (double the 12 in light divisions)
Combat Command structure allows flexible combined arms task organization
Self-propelled artillery maintains pace with armored advance
Mechanized infantry provides immediate infantry support
Garrison and training role in Morocco allowed for unit reorganization and preparation
tactical_innovations: Retained heavy division TO&E throughout the war while other divisions converted to light structure
Combat Command system enabled flexible task force organization
Integration of self-propelled artillery with armored maneuver elements
known_issues: Only elements deployed to Operation Torch - not full division strength
Limited combat experience in 1942-Q4 (garrison duties only)
Heavy division structure proved unwieldy in some operations
Units dispersed across multiple landing beaches (Mehedia, Safi) for Operation Torch
Tank crews and commanders still gaining experience in 1942
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Division training in Morocco during Q4 1942 focused on adapting to North African conditions. Minimal combat allowed for crew training, vehicle maintenance procedures for desert conditions, and unit cohesion building before potential deployment to Tunisia in 1943.

scenario_suitability: Safi landing and breakout (67th AR, 8-10 November 1942)
special_rules: Elements Only: Only 66th AR (1st Bn) and 67th AR (2nd/3rd Bn) deployed to combat in 1942-Q4
